items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-288-3136. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are:   short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the district until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. District policy adopted on April 10, 2007 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval.  All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the bid limit (currently $78,500) should have prior board approval as a separate Board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval:  all purchase orders for this period which includes all purchase orders for administratively-approved contracts exceeding $750 as well as any additional contracts that are not executed by way of purchase order as deemed appropriate to be added by purchasing.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts.

items.item_details:
Evergreen Valley College conducted a self study for submission to the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC), Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges (ACCJC).   Faculty, staff, students, and administrators from across campus participated in the self study.  It was a very diverse, qualified, and motivated group of leaders who brought a range of experience and perspectives to this process.
A draft of the self study report has been reviewed by and accepted by all governance groups on campus.  The final Accreditation Self Study document will be sent to AACJC no later mid August.   The AACJC site visit is scheduled for October 18-21, 2010.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the submission of Evergreen Valley Collegeâs Accreditation Self Study for 2009-2010 to WASC, AACJC.
items.item_text: 2009-10 Accreditation Self Study - Evergreen Valley College
items.item_text_raw: 11. 2009-10 Accreditation Self Study - Evergreen Valley College

items.item_details:
The courses outlines in this board item are being proposed for the Board of Trustees approval.
Each of the proposed courses have been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and approved by the All-College Curriculum Committee, acting on behalf of the local Academic Senate.  The rigor of the approval process assures that each new course has substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and that it fills a clear student need not being served by existing course offerings.
Listed here are the new courses being submitted for approval:
SPAN 034: Spanish-English Translation
SPAN 035:Sight Translation
SPAN 036A: Consecutive Interpretation I
SPAN 036B: Consecutive Interpretation II
SPAN 037A: Simultaneous Interpretation I
SPAN 037B: Simultaneous Interpretation II
SERV 001: Introduction to Community Service Learning
SETS 010: Energy Systems and Sustainability
BIS 011: Computer Keyboarding
BIS 102: Microsoft Excel

items.item_details:
The course outlined in this board item is being proposed for Board of Trustee approval.
	The proposed course has been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and approved by the Instructional Policies and Curriculum Committee, acting on behalf of the local Academic Senate. The rigor of the approval process assures that each new course has substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and that it fills a clear student need not being served by existing course offerings.
	 
Course and Title:      BIOL 066: Botany                                                          3.0 Units
Lecture Hours:   3.0
Lab Hours:         0.0
Advisory Basic Skills:  Read and Write Level 3, Math Level 2
Prerequisite:   None
Corequisite:    None
Recommended Preparation:  None
Course Description:  Students study plant anatomy, physiology, cellular morphology and the ecological and social issues concerning plants. Students will also examine terrestrial and aquatic organisms and their evolution. Field trips are required. Biology 066 is a course designed to introduce majors and non-majors to plant biology.
Credit Status:  AA/AS

items.item_details: The Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College Academic Senates after consultation with their respective curriculum committees have approved a change to the transfer degree (Associate of Arts) General Education pattern so it conforms exactly in area and unit requirements with the California State University General Education-Breadth pattern area and unit requirements.  This change has been approved to bring the colleges into compliance with California Community College guidelines for General Education patterns for transfer degrees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Resolution from the Academic Senates at Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College to change the AA degree General Education pattern to be in alignment with the California State University system.

items.item_details: The scope of this project includes upgrades to the existing Chiller in the EVC Central Plant.Â  These upgrades are necessary to keep up with the increased demand for cooling with the Center for the Arts project coming on-lineÂ and the upcoming summer season.

items.item_details: This agreement includes a comprehensive review and assessment of the presence of asbestos and lead in the existing Fine Arts buildings at San José City College.  The services will also include the development of technical specifications for the abatement and removal of these materials, construction administration and air monitoring services required to comply with the requirements of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a Professional Services Agreement with ACC Environmental Consultants Inc., in the amount of not to exceed $23,260.00, to provide comprehensive Hazmat assessment and removal from the existing Fine Art buildings at San José City College.

items.item_text_raw: 17. Agreement For Hazardous Materials Assessment & Removal – Existing Fine Arts Buildings - SJCC

items.item_details: This agreement covers the scope of comprehensive services for the furniture layout and design for the proposed Multi-Disciplinary + Arts project at San José City College.  These services will include an assessment of user needs and development of detailed furniture solutions for the project.  Services will also include the coordination with the architectural and technology needs, verify and recommend appropriate layouts to comply with ADA and storage, work closely with the Purchasing Department to complete the procurement process and assist in the final delivery and installation of all furniture for the project.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a Professional Services Agreement with KRJ Design Group in the amount of not to exceed $46,500.00, to provide comprehensive furniture design, planning and construction administration services for the Multi-Disciplinary + Arts project at San José City College.
items.item_text: Agreement For Design Services – Furniture – Multi-Disciplinary & Arts Building - SJCC
items.item_text_raw: 18. Agreement For Design Services – Furniture – Multi-Disciplinary & Arts Building - SJCC

items.item_details: This agreement includes comprehensive engineering support services required for the coordination and design of the utility connections from the College Central Plant to the Multi-Disciplinary Classroom + Arts building at San José City College.  These services will include the assessment of the electrical, gas, telecommunication, domestic water, hot & cold water line connections to the campus utility infrastructure.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a Professional Services Agreement with Salas O’Brien Engineers, Inc., in the amount of not to exceed $77,835.00, to provide comprehensive engineering support services for the coordination and installation of all major utility connections from the Central Plant to the proposed Multi-Disciplinary Classroom + Arts project at San José City College.
items.item_text: Agreement For Engineering Support Services – Utility Coordination – Multi-Disciplinary Classroom & Arts Project - SJCC
items.item_text_raw: 19. Agreement For Engineering Support Services – Utility Coordination – Multi-Disciplinary Classroom & Arts Project - SJCC

items.item_details:
This agreement covers comprehensive master planning services for the updated 2025 facility master plans for both San Jose City and Evergreen Valley Colleges as well as the District Office.  Services included in this agreement will be based in 3 phases, 1) Draft 2025 Site Plans  2) Analysis and Option Development 3) Solution Development and Documentation.  Deliverable for this agreement will include the following:
EVC and SJCC draft campus updated 2025 Facility Master Plans
2025 District Facilities Master Plans – Printed and Electronic files for Website posting
30 x 42 color presentation boards
Handouts for final board presentation and adoption
Final Electronic PDF files for website posting
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a Professional Services Agreement with HMC Architects in the amount of not to exceed $80,000.00, to provide comprehensive facilities master planning services for development of the updated 2025 facility master plans for San Jose City and Evergreen Valley Colleges.

items.item_text_raw: 20. Agreement For Facilities Planning Services – 2025 Updated Facilities Master Plans

items.item_details: The two portable restrooms installed at San Jose City College were initially installed on a lease basis.  The college has made a determination that as a consideration based on need and for the long term it will be prudent to purchase these units that are in the vicinity of the existing athletic fields.

items.item_details:
The scope of this project includes a comprehensive one-time tree removal and pruning project that will address the long term back log of tree removal and pruning on both campuses.  This project is based on a district wide assessment of the existing deceased trees, and identifies the removal of dead trees and trees that present a safety hazard to adjacent buildings.
Bids for the project were opened on Wednesday, May 26th 2010 and the bid summary is attached.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve and award the construction contract to Kingsborough Atlas Tree Surgery Inc. in the amount of not to exceed $177,000.00 being the lowest, responsive bidder for the Tree Pruning and Removal Project at SJCC and EVC Colleges.
items.item_text: Award Of Construction Contract - Tree Removal & Pruning – District Wide
items.item_text_raw: 22. Award Of Construction Contract - Tree Removal & Pruning – District Wide

items.item_details: Workforce Institute has been awarded a grant from the Betty and Gordon Moore Foundation through the California Institute for Nursing & Health Care ("CINHC") on behalf of the South Bay RN Transition Collaborative. Workforce Institute will provide both fiscal and program management in addition to the resources of the Institute's medical simulation lab. Currently, 40% of all new nurse graduates are unemployed in California. Therefore, the purpose of this grant is to provide a post-licensure training program for a minimum of 48 new unemployed RN graduates from the 5-county San Francisco Bay Area nursing schools so they will be more fully prepared for the role of staff nurse and hence more employable when the economy improves. Over the next 18 months, three cohorts of RN participants will undergo training comprised of didactic lectures, medical simulation, and clinical time at partnering health care agencies. Grant partners include Evergreen Valley College Nursing Program, San Jose State University School of Nursing, Samuel Merritt San Mateo Learning Center, Santa Clara Valley Medical Center, O'Connor Hospital, Good Samaritan Hospital, Mission Hospice, SEIU-UHW, and Work2future.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the South Bay RN Transition Program Collaborative Grant.
items.item_text: Workforce Institute - South Bay RN Transition Program Collaborative Grant
items.item_text_raw: 23. Workforce Institute - South Bay RN Transition Program Collaborative Grant

items.item_details: The City of San Jose is the recipient of a State of California Workforce Investment Grant to serve WIA eligible clients within the San Jose Silicon Valley Workforce Investment area. This spring, the Institute submitted a response to Work2future’s request for information regarding short and intensive training programs that match regionally identified employment needs.  This was a competitive process for which other community colleges, San Jose State University, and private training providers also submitted proposals. The Institute was selected to provide training for cohorts of WIA clients in the following areas: Project Management Certificate Program; Water Distribution Treatment Operator Certificate Program; Administrative Associate Certificate Program; and Apprentice Roofers Readiness Program. The purpose of the Master Cohort Training Contract with Workforce Institute is to provide the selected occupational classroom training to dislocated workers enrolled through the City’s One-Stop centers.  The term of this agreement is May 1, 2010 through December 31, 2010.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the WIA Work2future Master Cohort Training Contract.
items.item_text: Workforce Institute —Work2Future Master Cohort Training Contract
items.item_text_raw: 24. Workforce Institute —Work2Future Master Cohort Training Contract

items.item_details: Board of Trustees to approve out of state travel for student, Allison Torres, to go to Boston, Massachusetts for a the conferencetitled Towards a More Socially Responsible Psychology at Boston Graduate School of Psychoanalysis.  The student will leave San Jose on Wednesday, July 14, 2010 and will be returning on Saturday, July 17, 2010.  The amount granted to the student to travel was provided by the Associated Students in the amount of $2550.00.  The purpose of the trip will be to gain insight on the struggle of ethical psychology and mental health and social justice issues.  Student will share the information with psychology classes and will do a panel presentation to the SJCC campus community and the Associated Students.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve out of state travel for students Raymond Woods and Allison Torres.

items.item_details:
In December 2009, the Board of Trustees reviewed and approved the Measure G Budget Revision.  As was stated, revisions will be presented to the board on a quarterly basis and as needed.
 
Certain budget revisions are required in the attached two projects at San José City College and two projects at Evergreen Valley College. These revisions are required to complete the projects and meet contractual obligations to close out the projects.  There will be no net change in the total overall budget for the listed projects.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees review and approve the revisions in the Measure G budget and recommendations for realignment.

items.item_details:
The First reading of Human Resources Board Policies Sections 3 and 7 were presented to the Board of Trustees at the May 11, 2010 meeting for information.
	 
The policies are being presented for approval.  For your information, Board Policy 7100, Commitment to Diversity, has been removed from action to be revised based on recommendations from Trustee Cruz at the May 11, 2010 meeting concerning inclusion of cultural competence.  
	 
Board Policy 7120, Recruitment and Selection, proposed policy was deleted and replaced with the current policy.

items.item_details: Pursuant to Education Code Section 5342 and Elections Code Section 10400 the Governing Board must formally request that the Board of Supervisors of Santa Clara County consolidate the election of our board members with that of the general election of November 2, 2010.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a resolution requesting that the Santa Clara County Board of Supervisors consolidate the November 2, 2010 election of the Governing Board of this District with the general election of that same date.

items.item_details:
Pursuant to Educational Code Section 5322 and Elections Code Section 13307 the Governing Board members must determine the content of the attached Specifications of the Election Order to send to the Santa Clara County Registrar of Voters.
In addition, on January 10, 2006, the Board approved the following policy regarding filing fees for the office of District Trustee:
BP 2140 Partial Reimbursement for Candidate Filing Fees
The district shall reimburse the Registrar of Voters for 3/4s of the filing fees and the candidate would pay 1/4th of the filing fees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the trustee areas up for election, the length of the candidates' statements and the payment of filing fees.

items.item_details:
The purpose of the Tentative Budget is to obtain the Board's approval of an interim budget for the new fiscal year that will authorize the District to expend funds beginning July 1, 2010 while the Legislature deliberates and adopts a final state budget for the fiscal year.  In September, the Adopted Budget will be presented for board approval reflecting final legislative actions.
	 
The Tentative Budget is provided as an attachment to this item and also can be accessed on the District's web site at http://www.sjeccd.edu/HTML/District/AdminServices.html.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the Tentative Budget for Fiscal Year 2010/2011.

items.item_details:
The revised DSEIR has been prepared in accordance with the California Environmental Quality Act (CEQA) Statutes and Guidelines.  The San Jose / Evergreen Community College District is the local lead agency for the Update and has supervised the preparation of the Revised DSEIR. This Revised DSEIR is an informational document which will inform and assist public agency decision makers and the general public of the potential environmental effects of the update, including significant effects that will be caused by implementing the Update.  Possible ways to minimize significant effects of implementation of the Update and reasonable alternatives to the Update are also identified in the Revised DSEIR.  This document assesses the impacts, including unavoidable adverse impacts and cumulative impacts, related to the construction / occupancy of the Update.
 
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees receive any public comments to the Revised DSEIR.  Any comments received will be incorporated into the final DSEIR to be certified by the Board of Trustees.
items.item_text: Public Comments - Draft Supplemental Environmental Report (Revised DSEIR) - San Jose City College Facilities Master Plan Uupdate 2011

items.item_details: The current educational facilities master plans for both San Jose City and Evergreen Valley Colleges have been reviewed and updated utilizing a comprehensive shared governance process that included faculty, staff, administrators and the community at large.Â  These plans will form the foundation upon which the 2025 updated facilities master plans will be developed. The draft 2025 facility master plans will be reviewed in the fall; options presented and discussed prior to inclusion into the final 2025 facility master plans.Â  The district office component will also be included into the final plans.

items.item_details:
BACKGROUND:  
Pursuant to Government Code Section 3547, the San Jose/Evergreen Community College District and the California School Employees Association, Chapter 363, present their collective bargaining agreement negotiation proposals for the 2010-2011 fiscal year as follows:
Article 6, Salaries
         The parties mutually agreed to open this Article in 2009-10 negotiations.
	 
Article 7, Benefits
         The parties mutually agreed to open this Article in 2009-10 negotiations.
	 
Article 8, Work Schedule
         The District has an interest in addressing concerns related to changing/adjusting
         work schedules.
	 
Article 12, Vacation
         CSEA has an interest in eliminating the “cap” of hours accrued.
         CSEA has an interest in addressing the application of vacation submission and
         approval.
	 
        The District has an interest in addressing how and when vacation is granted. 
	 
Article 13, Absences From Work
         CSEA has an interest in enhancing the definition and days earned for personal
         necessity.
	 
         The District has an interest in clarifying/correcting differential sick leave
         language. 
	 
New articles mutually agreed upon by the parties arising after the presentation of initial proposals shall be made public within 24 hours and the Board shall take action at a public meeting.
RECOMMENDATION:
Government Code 3547 requires that all initial proposals of exclusive representatives and of public school employees which relate to matters within the scope of representation shall be presented at a public meeting of the public school employer and thereafter shall become public record.   It is recommended that the Board conduct a public hearing at the July 13, 2010 Board meeting to allow the public the opportunity to express itself regarding the proposals and at the end of the public hearing adopt the proposals.
items.item_text: Presentation of the San Jose/Evergreen Community College District and the California School Employees Association, Chapter 363, Collective Bargaining Agreement Negotiation Proposals for the 2010-2011 Fiscal Year
items.item_text_raw: 4. Presentation of the San Jose/Evergreen Community College District and the California School Employees Association, Chapter 363, Collective Bargaining Agreement Negotiation Proposals for the 2010-2011 Fiscal Year

items.item_details:
It is of public concern that the Board have wittingly or unwittingly applied double standards as to the 'poor performance' of some employees but not that of others; and that the consequences suffered by those adversely affected are so very different from the others as to constitute a violation of equal democracy and equality of justice, as guaranteed under the Constitution and Flag of the United States, the Flag to which Board members pledge allegiance at each meeting.
	 
Benefits to be gained by reversing hurtful lay-offs: forgiveness, healing and a return to the SJECCD Values Statement, 'Opportunity, Equity and Social Justice'. Democracy in combating the fiscal crisis.
